alert.note: Alert for Eastern Rutland; Eastern Windsor; Western Rutland; Western Windsor (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 14 at 4:52PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Rutland and central Windsor Counties through 530 PM EDT... At 452 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Shrewsbury, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Woodstock, Rutland, Mount Holly, Killington, Mount Tabor, Tinmouth, Shrewsbury, Wallingford, Mt. Holly, Rutland - Southern Vermont Airport, Plymouth, Mendon, Clarendon, Bridgewater, Reading, Danby, Ludlow, Plymouth Union, East Clarendon and Belmont. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Rutland; Eastern Windsor; Western Rutland; Western Windsor
